description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S19 Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) to vary condition 2 (approved drawings) and condition 8 (detailed drawings - of work on the relevant part of the site) of Listed Building Consent ref: 220906LBC dated 20/05/2022 for: Extensions to existing Grade II Listed Public House (Use Class Sui Generis) and ancillary former stable building, with retention of public house use at ground floor and partial change of use to provide 9 self-contained residential units (Use Class C3), with associated internal and external alterations, kitchen extraction, cycle storage, and refuse storage. (Listed Building Consent). Variation seeks to regularise internal and external amendments/alterations including enhanced provision of photovoltaics to main roof; dry riser inlet; removal of chimney stack; removal of end section of exiting pub bar; addition of high-level slot window to the apartments main entrance lobby; extending pub kitchen area; window amendment to rear of stable house entryway elevation; updated design to terrace balustrading; introduction (or possible reinstatement) of window between two bay windows at first floor level (Carlyle Road) studio apartment (Unit 03); dismantled and rebuilt stable house roof; insertion of doors to the bin store and new pub entrance; alterations to extract duct height; alterations to stable house roof; retaining and refurbishing bay window to main stair; and provision of air source heat pump to stable house
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development (new work and work of making good) shall match the existing adjacent or original work in materials used and in detailed execution, including colour, textile, profiles and surface finishes, and, in the case of brickwork in respect of mortar, joints and facebond.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | All elements identified as per the submitted drawings and documents to be retained including the bar, panelling, plasterwork, cornices, skirtings, doors, chimneypieces, tiled hearths, architraves, radiators, floorboards, timber arches, etc, shall be fully protected during the course of the works on site and restored fully to their original appearance on completion.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | All dismantled elements identified as per the submitted drawings and documents including panelling, arches, corbels, roof trusses, chords, joists and other elements shall be carefully recorded, itemised, coded and set aside in a secure place and reinstated exactly to match their original appearance, prior to the occupation of any part of the building.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | The works to the parts of the development and Listed Building described below must be carried out in accordance with the approved details submitted within this application. Any deviation must be submitted to and approved in writting by Ealing Council prior to the commencement of work on the relevant part of the site:
i)	Restoration of all existing window joinery and metalwork.
ii)	Double glazing to retained windows.
iii)	Gabled flank elevation to stable building adjacent to passageway including window and door details.
iv)	Samples of facing and roofing materials to retained elements and new extensions.
v)	Doors to courtyard from South Ealing Road extension.
vi)	New dormer windows.
vii)	New internal main staircase
viii)	Floor strengthening / stiffening.
ix)	Surface treatment of new inserted structural elements in South Ealing Road extension.
x)	Reinstated door architraves at first floor level.
xi)	Method of cleaning external brickwork
xii)	Hard and soft landscaping.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the subject Listed Building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | No new plant, enclosure or other equipment shall be erected outside the building envelope hereby approved.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to the dismantling of the stable building roof, the existing roof timbers shall be exposed, photographed, coded and marked against a plan of the roof structure. The timbers are for reuse within the reconstructed roof of the stable building. Each item should be set aside, stored in a secure and weathertight place for inspection by the Council's historic buildings adviser. These full details should be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council prior to the reconstruction of the roof of the stable block.
Reason: The safeguard the special architectural and historic interest of this Grade II Listed Building.
